txt.en: 'This way. The drakes said the giants' hold is on the other side of the mountain.'
'Deal with these cretins for me, Ufmazat.'
'The Frost-bound have come to parley, ice-giants.'
'The tale of Storvâgûn reached even these high peaks.'
'Giants? I followed behind the hobgoblins as closely as I could without being seen.'
'Allow me to handle the diplomacy, Warlord.'
'We have lived in these mountains for generations, hobgoblin. The drakes threaten our borders, and now you have come threatening us with war?'
'Frost-bound, remove the Orcs from this area. Protect the ice-giants. By order of Warlord Dushtalbúk.'
'Swear yourselves to Hrímil Frost-heart, and to ME, or be counted among our enemies.'
'As you wish. This way.'
'REMOVE them? By whose order?'
Talk to Klúso
'We ask to meet with your chieftain in peace to discuss these matters. The Angmarim offer power to their new friends. I can personally attest to that.'
'War has come to Gundabad, and you must choose a side.'
Listen to the conversation
'Why bring these Angmarim with you? Their treacherous kind is not welcome here.'
'Who approaches the gates of Thyrstáth?'
'G-Gorgar the Ruthless!'
'What now?!'
'Rrgh. I am losing my patience-'
'Wh-what?!'
Scout Klúso has an interesting report to share: relations between the Orcs and hobgoblins may have finally reached a tipping point....
'He has finally grown spine enough to oppose me? So be it.'
'Stand aside, hobgoblins. We have come to remove the ice-giants from this area.'
'The hobgoblins began to head inside, but then, I heard more Orc-stomping coming down the path!'
Klúso is describing what he saw transpire between the hobgoblins and ice-giants.\n\nYou should listen to the conversation.
'We wish only to live in peace and prosperity under the reign of the dragon.'
Klúso is ready to describe what he saw earlier.\n\nYou should talk to Klúso.
'I quickly hid, for I knew I would be unable to face the number of Orcs I was hearing by myself!'
'It wasn't long after that the hobgoblins and Orcs started fighting. I think they're still fighting right now!'
'War has come to Gundabad, indeed.'
Instance: The Tipping Point
'I was scouting near Bazan-medan, the gate to the Clovengap, when I heard the stomping of many heavy feet.'
